SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Performs a zero correction in the device. It's recommended to perform this zero correction every time the range changes. The steps taken to this comes from the datasheet 6517B-901-01 Rev. B / June 2009 under Zero correct. It is as following. 1- Enable Zero check, 2- Set unit to read, 3- Set range to measure 4- Enable Zero Correction 5- Disable Zero check. For unit and range, it uses the last values selected, either via command or from the configuration file

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Configure the digital filter inside the Electrometer controller. Activating filters will reduce the number of readings per seconds the device will be able to handle

item.Description: Activate the filter in general, if this is OFF, none of the filters will operate
Activate the average filter inside the electrometer, it uses the Default value inside the device (last 10 readings) to do the average calculation, true for ON and False for OFF

The median filter is used to determine the “middle-most” reading from a group of readings that are arranged according to size. Activate the median filter inside the electrometer, true for ON and False for OFF

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Set integration rate, this will directly affect reading rates but reading rates are not going to be the same as reading rates

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Set unit to measure, the possibilities are: Current, Voltage, Charge or Resistance

item.Description: Set electrometer to use different modes: 1.- Current 2.- Volt 3.- Charge 4.- Resistance

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Set measurement range, it will use the current unit selected

item.Description: -1 for automatic range. Volts range from 0 to 210V, Current range from 0 to 21e-3Amps, Resistance from 0 to 100e18, Charge from 0 to +2.1e-6

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Start storing readings inside the electrometer buffer, this command will change detailedState from NotReadingState to ManualReadingState and do stop storing data into the buffer and publish the LFO there are 2 possibilities. Timeout happens (300 seconds) or sending a stopScan command

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Start storing readings inside the electrometer buffer for a fixed time, this command will change detailedState from NotReadingState to SetDurationReadingState and to stop storing data into the buffer and publish the LFO there are 2 possibilities. Reading during scanDuration time input in the command or sending a stopScan command

item.Description: Time in seconds from the start of the reading until the stop and then store into the FITS file. The start of the scan will take about 0.2seconds which is what the device takes to start the reading process

SALCommand.Author: aanania
SALCommand.Description: Command to stop a current reading process, when it finishes stopping the process it will read the data from the buffer and will publish the LFO event
